title: The Best Caramel Apples
method: Step 2: Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil. Dip apples in boiling water for a few seconds, using a slotted spoon, then dry with paper towels to remove any wax from the peels. Set apples aside to cool completely, about 30 minutes.
Step 3: Insert sticks into the bottom of each cooled apple through the core for a handle.
Step 4: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Stir brown sugar, sweetened condensed milk, corn syrup, and butter together in a saucepan over medium-high heat.

Step 5: Bring to a boil, stirring constantly, then reduce heat to medium. Cook until a candy thermometer reads 248 degrees F (120 degrees C), stirring constantly to prevent burning, about 25 to 30 minutes. A teaspoon of caramel dropped in a glass of cold water, should form a firm ball.
Step 6: Remove caramel from heat and stir in vanilla extract.
Step 7: Working quickly, dip each apple into the hot caramel to completely coat the apple and about 1/2 inch of the wooden handle.
Step 8: Sprinkle apples with any desired toppings while still hot.
Step 9: Let caramel apples cool on the prepared baking sheet, about 1 hour. Use caution, caramel is very hot.
